User.title: User
User.description: Represents a user in the ViewLoop application.

id.description: Unique identifier for the User entity (matches Firebase Auth UID).

email.description: The email address of the user.

createdAt.description: The date and time the user registered.

lastLogin.description: The date and time of the user's last login.

lastUpdated.description: The timestamp of the last update from the extension.

avatar.description: URL for the user's avatar image.

country.description: The country of the user, determined by IP address on signup.

country_code.description: The country code of the user (e.g., 'US', 'MA').

city.description: The city of the user, determined by IP address on signup.

points.description: The total points the user has accumulated.

Video.title: Video
Video.description: Represents a video in the ViewLoop application.

id.description: Unique identifier for the Video entity.

url.description: The YouTube URL of the video.

duration.description: The required watch duration for the video in seconds.

submissionDate.description: The date and time the video was submitted.

submitterId.description: Reference to User. (Relationship: User 1:N Video) The ID of the user who submitted the video.

WatchHistory.title: WatchHistory
WatchHistory.description: Represents a record of a user watching a video via the extension.

Session.title: Session
Session.description: Represents a user's video watching session.

userId.description: The ID of the user watching.

videoID.description: The ID of the video being watched.

createdAt.description: Timestamp when the session was created.

lastHeartbeatAt.description: Timestamp of the last heartbeat received.

totalWatchedSeconds.description: Total accumulated watch time in seconds.

adWatched.description: Whether an ad was watched during the session.

status.description: The current status of the session.

points.description: Points awarded for this session upon completion.

definition.description: Stores user profiles. Access is restricted to the user themselves.

params.name: userId
params.description: The unique ID of the user.

definition.description: Stores general video metadata. Publicly readable, but only writable by the submitter.

params.name: videoId
params.description: The unique ID of the video.

definition.description: Stores logs of video watching activity from the browser extension. Should only be writable by a trusted server process.

params.name: historyId
params.description: The unique ID of the history entry.

definition.description: Stores active watch sessions from the browser extension. Should only be writable by a trusted server process.

params.name: sessionId
params.description: The unique ID of the session (sessionToken).

firestore.reasoning: The Firestore data structure is simplified to support the new activity-based system. The primary collections are `/users` and `/videos`. The user's activity state (progress, level, bonus) is stored directly on their user document. This avoids complex transaction histories and makes activity updates atomic. Subcollections for user-specific data have been removed to simplify the model for this MVP. A new `watchHistory` collection is added to log events from the extension.
